abstract: A simple question from the jury strikes at the heart of the case against John F. Haggerty Jr.
snippet: A simple question from the jury strikes at the heart of the case against John F. Haggerty Jr.
lead_paragraph: As most lawyers would concede, trying to distill a deeper meaning from jurors' questions during deliberations can be a futile exercise.

headline.main: In Trial of Political Consultant, Jury Asks, Who Is the Victim?
